Record.ClassificationPath: Cardiovascular Diseases/Vascular Diseases/Arterial Occlusive Diseases/Leriche Syndrome

Findings_and_Disorders_Kind/Disease, Disorder or Finding/Disease or Disorder/Disorder by Site/Cardiovascular Disorder/Vascular Disorder/Non-Neoplastic Vascular Disorder/Arterial Disorder/Arterial Occlusion/Leriche Syndrome,/NCIThesaurus/Findings_and_Disorders_Kind/Disease, Disorder or Finding/Disease or Disorder/Syndrome/Leriche Syndrome
Record.Description: A condition caused by occlusion of terminal aorta, the primary branches of the ABDOMINAL AORTA, as in aortoiliac obstruction. Leriche syndrome usually occurs in males and is characterized by IMPOTENCE, absence of a pulse in the femoral arteries, weakness and numbness in the lower back, buttocks, hips, and lower limbs.
